metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8629 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The xdr_nullstring function in lib/kadm5/kadm_rpc_xdr.c in kadmind in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.13.4 and 1.14.x before 1.14.1 does not verify whether '\0' characters exist as expected, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted string. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled input strings. A remote authenticated attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information or cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-k5tls - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-kdc - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-kpropd - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-locales - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-multidev - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-otp - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-pkinit - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
krb5-user - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libgssrpc4 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libk5crypto3 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkdb5-9 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkrad0 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkrb5-3 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
libkrb5support0 - 1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> use of kadmind by touch and core is not supported

criterions.comment: krb5 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.14.3+dfsg-2ubuntu1').
